title: ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ California DMV Regular Driver (Class C) Written Test (50 cards)

test.question: You may drive off of the paved roadway to pass another vehicle:
test.A: A. If the shoulder is wide enough to accommodate your vehicle.
test.B: B. If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left.
test.C: C. Under no circumstances.

test.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing with no warning devices and are unable to see 400 feet down the tracks in one direction. The speed limit is:
test.A: A. 15 mph.
test.B: B. 20 mph.
test.C: C. 25 mph.

test.question: When parking your vehicle parallel to the curb on a level street:
test.A: A. Your front wheels must be turned toward the street.
test.B: B. Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb.
test.C: C. One of your rear wheels must touch the curb.

test.question: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:
test.A: A. At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway.
test.B: B. 5 to 10 MPH slower than the traffic on the freeway.
test.C: C. The posted speed limit for traffic on the freeway.

test.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:
test.A: A. Fog lights only.
test.B: B. High beams.
test.C: C. Low beams.

test.question: A white painted curb means:
test.A: A. Loading zone for freight or passengers.
test.B: B. Loading zone for passengers or mail only.
test.C: C. Loading zone for freight only.

test.question: A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You should:
test.A: A. Stop, then proceed when you think all of the children have exited the bus.
test.B: B. Slow to 25 MPH and pass cautiously.
test.C: C. Stop as long as the red lights are flashing.

test.question: California's "Basic Speed Law" says:
test.A: A. You should never drive faster than posted speed limits.
test.B: B. You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.
test.C: C. The maximum speed limit in California is 70 mph on certain freeways.

test.question: You just sold your vehicle. You must notify the DMV within ___ days.
To avoid last minute moves, you should be looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about ______________.
test.A: A. 5 to 10 seconds
test.B: B. 10 to 15 seconds
test.C: C. 15 to 20 seconds

test.question: You are about to make a left turn. You must signal continuously during the last ____ feet before the turn.
Which of the following statements about blind spots is true?
test.A: A. They are eliminated if you have one outside mirror on each side of the vehicle.
test.B: B. Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
test.C: C. Blind spots can be checked by looking in your rear view mirrors.

test.question: You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:
test.A: A. Leave a note on the vehicle.
test.B: B. Report the accident without delay to the city police or, in unincorporated areas, to the CHP.
test.C: C. Both of the above.

test.question: Unless otherwise posted the speed limit in a residential area is ____.
test.A: A. 20 mph
test.B: B. 25 mph
test.C: C. 30 mph

test.question: You may legally block an intersection:
test.A: A. When you entered the intersection on the green light.
test.B: B. During rush hour traffic.
test.C: C. Under no circumstances.

test.question: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be:
test.A: A. Turned to the left (toward the street).
test.B: B. Turned to the right (away from the street).
test.C: C. Parallel with the pavement.

test.question: With a Class C drivers license a person may drive:
test.A: A. A 3-axle vehicle if the Gross Vehicle Weight is less than 6,000 pounds.
test.B: B. Any 3-axle vehicle regardless of the weight.
test.C: C. A vehicle pulling two trailers.

test.question: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:
test.A: A. Any lane (as long as it is safe).
test.B: B. The lane closest to the left curb.
test.C: C. The lane in the center of the road.

test.question: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report (SR1) to the DMV:
test.A: A. Only if you or the other driver is injured.
test.B: B. If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.
test.C: C. Only if you are at fault.

test.question: Roadways are the most slippery:
test.A: A. During a heavy downpour.
test.B: B. After it has been raining for awhile.
test.C: C. The first rain after a dry spell.

test.question: You may not park your vehicle:
test.A: A. On the side of the freeway in an emergency.
test.B: B. Next to a red painted curb.
test.C: C. Within 100 feet of an elementary school.

test.question: You must notify the DMV within 5 days if you:
test.A: A. Sell or transfer your vehicle.
test.B: B. Fail a smog test for your vehicle.
test.C: C. Get a new prescription for lenses or contacts.

test.question: Two sets of solid, double, yellow lines that are two or more feet apart:
test.A: A. May be crossed to enter or exit a private driveway.
test.B: B. May not be crossed for any reason.
test.C: C. Should be treated as a separate traffic lane.

test.question: You want to make a right turn at an upcoming intersection. You should slow down and:
test.A: A. Move toward the left side of your lane.
test.B: B. Avoid driving in the bicycle lane.
test.C: C. Signal for 100 feet before turning.

test.question: You are driving on a freeway posted for 65 MPH. The traffic is traveling at 70 MPH. You may legally drive:
test.A: A. 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic.
test.B: B. Between 65 mph and 70 mph.
test.C: C. No faster than 65 mph.

test.question: It is illegal to park your vehicle:
test.A: A. In an unmarked crosswalk.
test.B: B. Within three feet of a private driveway.
test.C: C. In a bicycle lane.

test.question: The safest precaution that you can take regarding the use of cellular phones and driving is:
test.A: A. Use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel.
test.B: B. Keep your phone within easy reach so you won't need to take your eyes off the road.
test.C: C. Review the number before answering a call.

test.question: If you have a green light, but traffic is blocking the intersection, you should:
test.A: A. Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
test.B: B. Enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.
test.C: C. Merge into another lane and try to go around the traffic.

test.question: You are getting ready to make a right turn. You should:
test.A: A. Signal and turn immediately.
test.B: B. Stop before entering the right lane and let all other traffic go first.
test.C: C. Slow down or stop, if necessary, and then make the turn.

test.question: You must obey instructions from school crossing guards:
test.A: A. At all times.
test.B: B. Only during school hours.
test.C: C. Unless you do not see any children present.

test.question: It is a very windy day. You are driving and a dust storm blows across the freeway reducing your visibility. You should drive slower and turn on your:
test.A: A. Interior lights.
test.B: B. Parking lights.
test.C: C. Headlights.

test.question: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should:
test.A: A. Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane.
test.B: B. Assume the other driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal.
test.C: C. Assume the other driver will maintain a constant speed.

test.question: You are driving on a freeway posted for 65 mph. Most of the other vehicles are driving 70 mph or faster. You may legally drive:
test.A: A. 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic.
test.B: B. Between 65 mph and 70 mph.
test.C: C. No faster than 65 mph.

test.question: If you drive faster than other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction and continually pass the other cars, you will:
test.A: A. Get you to your destination much faster and safer.
test.B: B. Increase your chances of an accident.
test.C: C. Help prevent traffic congestion.

test.question: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?
test.A: A. Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards.
test.B: B. Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.
test.C: C. Any vehicle with 3 or more axles or weighing more than 4,000 pounds.

test.question: You are driving on a one-way street. You may turn left onto another one-way street only if:
test.A: A. A sign permits the turn.
test.B: B. Traffic on the street moves to the right.
test.C: C. Traffic on the street moves to the left.

test.question: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:
test.A: A. May complete its turn in either of the two lanes.
test.B: B. May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.
test.C: C. Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning.

test.question: You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle, if the yellow line next to:
test.A: A. The other side of the road is a solid line.
test.B: B. Your side of the road is a broken line.
test.C: C. The other side of the road is a broken line.

test.question: At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, you should always:
test.A: A. Stop, listen, and proceed cautiously.
test.B: B. Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming.
test.C: C. Slowly pass vehicles that seem to be stopped for no reason.

test.question: You drive defensively when you:
test.A: A. Always put one car length between you and the car ahead.
test.B: B. Look only at the car in front of you while driving.
test.C: C. Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.

test.question: You are driving on the freeway. The vehicle in front of you is a large truck. You should drive:
test.A: A. Closely behind the truck in bad weather because the driver can see farther ahead.
test.B: B. Farther behind the truck than you would for a passenger vehicle.
test.C: C. No more than one car length behind the truck so the driver can see you.

test.question: All of the following practices are dangerous to do while driving. Which of these is also illegal?
test.A: A. Listening to music through headphones that cover both ears.
test.B: B. Adjusting your outside mirrors.
test.C: C. Transporting an unrestrained animal inside the vehicle.

test.question: Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
test.A: A. You don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
test.B: B. The railroad crossing is located in a city or town that has frequent train traffic.
test.C: C. You transport two or more young children in a passenger vehicle.

test.question: When you tailgate other drivers (drive close to their rear bumper):
test.A: A. You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry.
test.B: B. Your actions cannot result in a traffic citation.
test.C: C. You help reduce traffic congestion.

test.question: Should you always drive slower than other traffic?
test.A: A. No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.
test.B: B. Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique.
test.C: C. Yes, it is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

test.question: You see a signal person at a road construction site ahead. You should obey his or her instructions:
test.A: A. Only if you see orange cones on the road ahead.
test.B: B. Unless they conflict with existing signs, signals, or laws.
test.C: C. At all times.

test.question: When can you drive in a bike lane?
test.A: A. During rush hour traffic if there are no bicyclists in the bike lane.
test.B: B. When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right.
test.C: C. When you want to pass a driver ahead of you who is turning right.

test.question: You see a flashing yellow traffic signal at an upcoming intersection. The flashing yellow light means:
test.A: A. Stop before entering the intersection as long as you can do so safely.
test.B: B. Stop. Yield to all cross traffic before crossing the intersection.
test.C: C. Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.

test.question: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should:
test.A: A. Make eye contact and then pass him/her.
test.B: B. Slow down as you pass him/her.
test.C: C. Stop and let him/her finish crossing the street.

test.question: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
test.A: A. In both directions may pass.
test.B: B. Next to the broken line may pass.
test.C: C. Next to the solid line may pass.
